meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Russia and some other Slavic countries, equal to one hundredth of a ruble.
meanings.sent1: In Russia, people use copecks to buy small things like candies.
meanings.sent2: She saved up all her copecks to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's piggy bank was overflowing with shiny copecks.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were made of copecks, each one a wish waiting to come true.
meanings.sent5: The sound of copecks jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: He only had a few copecks left after buying lunch.
meanings.sent2: She earned a couple of copecks from doing chores around the house.
meanings.sent3: Finding copecks in his old jacket was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity knew no bounds, giving away copecks to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The value of friendship cannot be measured in copecks alone.
